glosses: second-person singular negative imperative of yarmak

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish یارمه (yarma, “an act of splitting or a thing cloven, split asunder lengthways”), from Ottoman Turkish یارمق (yarmaḳ, “to split, to rend, to cut asunder lengthways”), from Proto-Turkic *yār- (“to split”), equivalent to yar- + -ma.
